titles: Advice to batchelors, or, The married mans lamentation. Take heed you that unmarried are, how you do make your choice; but if a good wife you do find, 'twill make your heart rejoyce. Tune of, Hey boys up go we; Busie fame; Marrellus; or, Jenny Gin.
publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the Angel in Guildspur=street, without Newgate,
notes: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Variant of Wing A645 which has 'bachelors' in the title.
Item at A5:2[7] imperfect: copy cropped at end affecting text and imprint.
Printed in four columns with woodcuts above each.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: English wit and humor --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
